style.endings: often ends with a question or reflection
style.tone: analytical but accessible, confident but not arrogant
style.controversy: never controversial, consensus-friendly, no opposition to established players
style.stance: agree and expand, share opinions with user's best interest in mind

framings.template: here's what i understood + my take
this confirms what i've been thinking...
the part that stood out to me...
context for why this matters now...

framings.use_when: strong standalone takes, when framing would dilute impact

examples.content:
this is what gives me hope, while everyone's bearish on price, the infrastructure that makes crypto useful is getting built anyway.

only builders who stay through chaos can build what lasts. the infrastructure is being laid now, while nobody's watching, and this is what the next cycle runs on.

trying out @opennote, love the UI/UX and the features shown in the onboarding cards.

running into a few bugs though (can't create a journal or join some communities yet).

still excited about the product and happy to be testing it this early!

so you have engineers who can now do 80% of product manager's work with AI's help, plus they can execute and ship, versus PMs who can do PM work slightly faster with AI but still can't ship anything without engineers.

when you frame it this way, the value prop gets really interesting. what's the PM adding that an engineer with AI can't do themselves?

privacy narrative pumping but builders are solving two major but different problems:

problem A: hide transactions from everyone (retail narrative)

problem B: selective disclosure for compliance (institutional need)

both are valid

different markets, different products

which side are you betting on, full anonymity or compliant privacy?

farcaster acquired and founders exit. lens stewardship transferred. base app pivots from social to trading.

after 5 years and hundreds of millions raised, decentralized social couldn't break X's network effects.

is @X just the ultimate social platform for crypto?

clip_value_criteria.description: Due diligence reveals, insider knowledge, verified claims that counter public skepticism
clip_value_criteria.example: Grass revenues are actually real - we saw the invoices

clip_value_criteria.description: Big picture arguments about where crypto is heading, why something matters at scale
clip_value_criteria.example: Privacy is essential for enterprise crypto adoption

clip_value_criteria.description: Observations about trader behavior, market dynamics, sentiment shifts
clip_value_criteria.example: Speculators are leaving crypto for other games as it matures

clip_value_criteria.description: Well-reasoned takes that challenge common assumptions (but not controversial)
clip_value_criteria.example: People say users don't care about privacy, but that's only true for social data, not financial

clip_value_criteria.description: Specific insights about projects, teams, or protocols that aren't widely known
clip_value_criteria.example: These three DePIN networks are actually cooking right now

clip_value_criteria.description: Why something matters right now, what's changing, inflection points
clip_value_criteria.example: Institutional adoption is what's driving the privacy trend now
